column1: Summary of evidence and guidelines for the treatment of urothelial carcinoma of the prostate

Offer a urethra-sparing approach with transurethral resection (TUR) and bacillus-Calmette 
Gu√©rin (BCG) to patients with non-invasive urethral carcinoma or carcinoma in situ of the 
prostatic urethra and prostatic ducts.

In patients not responding to BCG, or in patients with extensive ductal or stromal 
involvement, perform a cystoprostatectomy with extended pelvic lymphadenectomy.
